intro: Cota cretacea, commonly known as the Crete cota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Cota cretacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
